item.description:
You’re invited to join us for November’s FREE community evening:

Connecting to your Inner Wisdom to Get “Unstuck”

Note: Through mid November, we're collecting non-perishable foods and clean, in good condition clothing to donate to A Place to Turn, which provides emergency food and clothing to those in need in about 30 towns in Metro West MA.  This is totally voluntary.  No pressure.  If you feel inclined, please bring what you'd like to donate.  We're accepting financial donations, as well; as there is great need on all counts.  Thank you!

  • Do you feel an inner “tug of war” over some things, like, “I wish –x-, but I also want –y-.” (I want to be thinner; but I also want to eat what I want!”) One part of you wants one thing, but another part wants something else.
  • Do you hear yourself saying, “I can’t.” or “I wish I had the willpower or discipline to do that.”?
  • Do you feel stuck in some part of your life you wish you could get on with?

These are often signs of having an inner conflict or a limiting belief around what you want. Would it be nice to end the suffering caused by what seems like an inner battle?

Tonight, through a combination of instruction and guided inner, meditative processes, you can discover how what seem like inner enemies can actually be your inner allies when you connect inwardly in the right way.

By participating in this experiential evening, you’ll learn:

  • How to reach a satisfying and comfortable resolution to your inner conflicts.
  • How to more easily and spontaneously act in ways that fit with who you want to be as a person, honoring all parts of yourself, without any need for will power or discipline, but with ease and flow.
  • How to open up new possibilities for yourself in something you’re currently feeling emotionally drained by.

All are welcome to this free community event! The evening is appropriate for everyone. Please invite others to sign up and join you. Share this with your friends, family and groups.

“Overall, it was a wonderful experience! It was great to connect with my inner self through the meditations as well as learn a new technique that allowed myself to be at peace (instead of stuck) with certain struggles. Thank you!” Amy

Space is limited, so registration is required.  Please plan on arriving around 7:10 to get settled so we can begin on time; and please be considerate and be sure to let us know if your plans change.

“It was much more than I expected. It was a wonderful foundation for resolution to a conflict I’ve had for years. I feel free and lifted with the guidance I received tonight.” Cassandra

Class leader: Ann Ide, M.A., Spiritual Life Coach with www.NewPossibilitiesCoaching.com, certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond struggles and mere survival, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. With her expert questioning, inner exploration processes and personal change interventions, clients become emotionally and spiritually aligned to more easily create the happiness they want.

This public event is co-sponsored by Earthsong Yoga and New Possibilities Coaching as a community service and is being shared with you because of its relevancy to being an effective deliberate creator.
item.how_to_find_us: It's the big, old Corey building, only sign is on sidewalk. Studio is upstairs, in room 14. Easy parking

group.name: "Good Vibrations" Metro West Law of Attraction Community

item.name: Free community evening of guided meditations: Getting Unstuck
